page.title: 07TIBBERMORE (2)
page.content: The oldest gravestone is dated 1727. In 1841 the death of local farmer John Ritchie, cattle breeder, is remembered by his memorial stone showing a cow, curling stones and brooms - his hobby. A sheaf of wheat is shown too. The roof of the church has crow steps and a bell dated 1484-1515 and the "Thomes Potter me made". The bell is rung by a chain hanging outside the church. In the field next to the church is a boundry stone marked K on one side and C on the other. The name Tibbermore comes from the Gaelic - well of Mary. The Lady Well has been filled, and no trace remains.
